one_reviews_text:
If you updated the codec on the screen, bravo! The quality seems to have improved on the Quest 2 by a lot! 

Awesome tour of the White House. I really appreciate the scale of everything shown.

I would definitely show this to my youngest family members when they get to an age to learn about Obama and how he involuntarily divided the country because of people in 12 of the comments here. I'm sure they knew this would rile up the red coats.
I wonder why the Trumps didn't create one? Not that I'm complaining. lol
A great video showing the white house.

This was pretty neat for what it is, showing some of the White House in a 360 view was cool. Not too long and not too short, I felt like the 22 minute length hit the mark for a free, rather lite experience.  What puzzled me was the vantage point they give you. When Obama is sitting down in the Oval Office, the view seems right. The rest of the time your still at that same level, I felt like a kid on a tour of the White House, which is probably how they mean you to feel... lol. Not as heavily political as I thought it would be from other reviews, about what I expected. Overall, worth the time.
On oculus link with no remote

review_title: Has a weird echo a lag
one_reviews_text: The whole thing is this wierd laggy echo thing.  I've had it for like 3 years now and have a VERY powerful computer and just reinstalled windows and this app and still no go.
review_feedback: Hi, we are sorry to hear about the lag you're experiencing. Could you send an email to QA@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your dxdiag file? (Search "dxdiag" on Windows to run the diagnostic). Our team will be able to help you from there. Thank you!

one_reviews_text:
I was looking forward to trying this out, but unfortunately the entire experience has this strange slow motion and audio echo effect to it, as if it is slowly and incorrectly loading. 
It may just be for me perosnally but I haven't had any similar issues with anything else. I have tried reinstalling it a couple of times but to no avail. Hopefully a fix will come for this so I can enjoy the experience that many others have.
review_feedback: Hi, we are sorry to hear about this. Could you send an email to QA@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your dxdiag file? (Search "dxdiag" on Windows to run the diagnostic). Our team will be able to help you from there. Thank you!

one_reviews_text:
5 stars = 4 stars with the best graphics 
4 stars = definitely a realy good investment, will spent a lot of time with it
3 stars = works perfectly, would probably even give some money for it
2 stars =good enough to keep it installed and open it from time to time, wouldn't buy it (again)
1 star = wouldn't buy or install it again but did try / didn't work properly
I enjoyed this and show it to first time vr users
This needs to support touch controllers. I don't use the remote for anything.
review_feedback: Hi, you should be able to use your touch controllers in the app. Could you send an email to QA@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue? Our team will be able to help you from there. Thank you!

one_reviews_text: However, I did enjoy this and always liked the Obamas
worked gear in Gear VR on my S7. But can not install on my s10e.
It feels like you are really there. A fantastic tour narrated by a real President and First Lady. It really takes me back to the days when things were normal. It's a nice tour, and a great escape.

It's basically 22 minutes of 360 degrees video, but you get the most amazing tour of the White House, and I'm a great fan of Obama - you even get to see his top-secret and private man cave! The video has a lot of detail, it nearly feels like being there. I used Oculus Tray Tool to force super-sampling 2.0, it worked perfectly. It was  an emotional ride, maybe I'm getting old and soft - but this great tour profoundly touched me. Of course it should have won an Emmy! :-)

Video a little blurry, but a nice way to see the White House with out going there.
Would have liked the narrator (Obama) to stick with the tour and not tout his failed policy's as good for our country.  As a previous reviewer commented, this is just more  Obama fluff.
Keeps failing installation. I am able to install plenty of other Oculus games.

Meet the President, 1 meter away from you eyes, talking to you and narrating a Historical Visit of the White House.
Thrilling moments of intimacy with Barack and Michelle Obama and wonderful views of the main rooms of the WH.
Very impressive, very interresting, a Great Moment.
The app just never launched.
VR gives a great sense of scale that you can't get unless you really go there. The Obama family's eloquence lends itself masterfully to this awe inspiring look inside of the White House.

I never knew much about the interior of the White House. Seeing each individual room and hearing commentary was surreal, as if I were there. I don't approve of Barrack's policies, but he and Michelle were fantastic narrators for this tour.

review_title: It's good, but Emmy Award winning?
one_reviews_text:
I always wanted to take a tour of the White House and now we can. VR gives you a sense of scale in each room or office that pictures simply can not do. The scenes are narrated by the former-President and his wife. Well worth it for a historian like myself (i.e. Free).

But Emmy Award Winning? Come on. 
Maybe place that trophy next to the Nobel Peace Prize.

review_title: A gift to the whole world
one_reviews_text:
The torch of freedom still shines bright all around the world. It is a absolute privilege and great honor to be able to take tour through the real White House. Especially for a foreigner it's a big pain to get an invitation. So I had to skip that one during my trip last year.
But this VR-experience is really an excellent alternative. It was also nice to meet the Obamas again. It really feels like being taken around by the former president himself.

Thanks for everything, dear Barack and Michelle Obama. You served your country well. And I hope we are going to see more high-quality content like this from their successors.

I've had my criticisms about President Obama and his policies, but this experience showcases his undeniable respect for the office he held, and you truly feel the intense importance of this place, its history, and  strong emotional connections with the place while watching this journey throughout the first residence. Although more pixelated than I'd prefer, it was still well worth the time and something not to be missed on the Rift or Gear VR.

Definitely sit down (in a swivel chair) for this one. If you're standing then it's a bit disorienting when you move. It's just a 360-degree movie, so you can't walk around and look around corners (because it's filmed, not animated), but otherwise it's a really fantastic experience. It's incredibly special to see around the White House and hear a bit about the history and the experiences of people living there.

We Americans, as a people, don't know enough about our own government.  We don't know our history or our institutions.  And we're sorely lacking in humility and perspective.

Now, with a pompous bafoon berating that beautiful, meaningful building from within, it was wonderful and refreshing to hear the eloquence of President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama.  Their composure and dignity and self-awareness is so sorely missed by, at least, this American.

So, thanks to them and to the people who put this experience together.  It was moving and mournful.

Please don't do one for President Trump.  I have enough trouble thinking about him being in the White House without an immersive 3D experience making it all too real.

I never had the opportunity to visit the White House. 
This tour was amazing. 
I always admire President Obama. So his appaerance was most pleasent.
Wish we would get such a politician in Germany.
The video was very clear, colors were accurate, and the 3D was comfortable. Overall a incredible technical work

review_title: Always wanted to visit the White House
one_reviews_text: Tour is great.  Haven't yet had a chance to visit in person and it's great to get a VR look at it.

There are currently 99 reviews and 19 people gave it a 1 star rating, LOL.  What a sad existence to hate Obama so much that you download the video for the sole purpose of giving it one star.  How sad can your life be, really?  Well, if you don't know whether to download it or not, trust me it's a very good, well-made 360 video tour.  The quality is not the best, but it's up there.  Your jaw will drop when Obama is sitting there in front of you and you can see shine of his shoes.  It is only slightly political, it's mostly about the tour of the White House and the history there.  So you don't have to be a liberal to enjoy the tour.  Just a decent human being.

You can and most likely will feel strong emotions during the tour. I found out that you can cry buckets into your Rift and it will be just fine. I think this moved me and gave me a sense of awe in a way no real life tour would.

Very well done.  Bittersweet emotional experience for an American to get to sit next to a phenomenal president and first lady and have a personal tour.  Even if you are inexplicably not a fan of the former president, it is worth it to see the White House in good resolution 360.

review_title: Great tour of the White House!
one_reviews_text: A good, positive tour of a beautiful building - all the negative reviews I've read are fixated on the writer's political views and have nothing to do with this "experience".

I'm not sure if there are any places they didn't cover, but as far as I'm concerned this covered enough. Clear, informative voice-overs from former president and first lady, and no tourists corrupting the atmostphere.
This was one of the coolest experiences ever for VR! It really seems like they are sitting next to you telling you about the history of the White House. I wish it was longer!

That's not the name of a military official. I was looking forward to watching this but the app has a double stuttering audio issue and the video, on the whole, seem to be on a 50%-75% playback speed. =\

It was about the home, not a singular president. It made it feel homey. The tour showed many different perspectives. I loved being sat down and talked to like a person. I liked that I was able to look around in 360 at everything. It was great. I would like another tour that allowed me motion through the rooms when I was in there so I could have more time and not have to pause, but I see what the intent was here and it was well deployed.

review_title: Excellent tour of the white house
one_reviews_text: A lot of interesting info about the history behind the white house and about the previous presidents who lived there. Good to see the tour presented by the last president who actually won the popular vote, and not the pathological lying, whining manchild currently holding the office after a helping hand from Russia. As for Obama being the worst president; according to who? Do you people have any clue what a "fact" is? What "evidence" is? How about "critical thought"? Of course you don't. All you know is what Propagandist in Chief Trump tells you. Enjoy the abysmal approval numbers, and just keep telling yourselves it's all fake news.
Very much enjoyed the tour. The video feels a little blurrier than I'd like and consequently wore out my eyes a bit, but I loved the experience in spite of that. Worth a look!
was ok but too pixelated couldnt enjoyed not worth downloading...
Really well done. Makes me miss the Obamas :)

If you're looking for a lengthy view of the white house, this is almost perfect. I say almost because it should have focused on that all the way, but there's a bit of politics to be swallowed every time you want to watch this. The resolution and quality is the best for this kind of experiences. And being two arm lengths away from the Obamas does deliver a sense of fulfillment. I'm also thankful that this experience was done in the time of barack obama. I can't describe how horrid this would have been if i had to stare eye to eye with trump everytime i watched it.

Obama is "not going down as the worst president in history". He's actually ranked the 13th best. Not that you know anything about politics, you can't even write a complete sentence you uneducated troglodytes.

Anyway... This app is really informative. It's well narrated and the video is decent. It's definitely not the killer app, but it's a really good tour of the White House. I have never visited there and probably never will since it now probably smells like coconut spray tan and KFC, so I am glad this will be available for kids to see what the White House was like before it became the White Trash House.
As a non-US person the subject matter wasn't hugely my cup of tea. The video quality is decent although needless to say has the same issues as any 360 video. 20 min runtime.

Respect, humility and little part of history.
 
Hard to imagine what the place looks like now !

I use this vr experience to escape from the modern apocalypse that is the Trump  administration and explore what the White House was like before 2017. The experience offers a great balance between the historical aspects of the White House's history and politics of the Obama presidency. This tour also gives you information about how Barack and Michelle spent their day to day life in the White House and a detailed examination of every room about its purpose and historical prevalence. Would recommend for anyone who is a history buff or would simply like to escape to a happier time of executive administration in the U.S. Government.

I liked the tour; saw various rooms of the White House. It was jarring to see President Obama almost full-size in my eyes. However, the whole narrative was not captioned/subtitled. This is disappointing. It would also have been nice to move around a little bit in the rooms.
Wow. Just wow. This was an exceptional VR experience and I am grateful to have it. I have played this for many friends who are now out purchasing VR equipment for themselves. Excellent job!
This was a really great experience and meant a lot to me being able to see the white house first hand, caught me off guard. 3D quality was really great for a 360 video!

As far as 360 videos go this is, like the other Obama Whitehouse app, the best quality you'll find. Genuinely amazing to get to visit all of the famous rooms in the White House plus many not-so-well-known bits, and to hear from the Obamas about their experiences there.
Only issue: some stuttering when moving head around, which I don't get in any other app. I have a high spec machine so it's some problem with this app.
Seeing the interior of the White House in VR is a neat experience. The sound was all messed up on mine, but the visuals were great. Fix the sound and it would be five stars.
bad

This is the best VR experience I have ever had. I've seen these rooms on television, but nothing is like being there. This is a backstage pass to American history, narrated by the President and First Lady themselves and is the pinnacle of VR's journey so far. Sitting across from two of the most well educated, well intentioned, and powerful people this world has ever seen, and listening to them talk about their time in the White House was a privilege. This is how President Obama should narrate his autobiography. Amazing.
Almost like being in the White House.  I enjoyed the tour.
Views didn't feel 'live' until the Obama's spoke. When do we get to see the Trump update?
This is a great tour 360, again fantastic video quality here. Opens up a world of possibilities for VR tourism.
another obama fluff piece to mask the horrible things he did to this country as president, probably paid for by the taxpayers

review_title: Magnificent Tour of the White House
one_reviews_text: Felix and Paul Studios are undoubtedly one of the leaders of cinematic VR, and this 360 video is another excellent work to add to their list of expertly produced experiences. Filmed over five days during November and December 2016, the former President and First Lady take audiences on an intimate tour of the White House, guiding them through the halls of this iconic building. The immersive documentary is 22-minutes in length and allows anyone to step into the rooms of the White House and hear from the Obamas about their time in the residence. President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama were able to layer in their personal memories in addition to historic references to contextualize the rooms that are indelibly imprinted on so many minds across the world. Don't let this piece of entertainment go unwatched.

review_title: A wonderful tour of the White House
one_reviews_text: Really captures the magic and impact of the White House. Resonates strongly hearing President Barack Obama and Michelle Obama personally narrating the tour.

Great tour and experience. Would have been nice if it was in 4k as others have suggested. To those of you who left negative reviews solely because you thought this is pushing some sort of a hidden political agenda, get over yourselves. The only reason there's no Fox News/Breitbart VR experiences out there for you is because they're already a fantasy experience.
I enjoyed this alot but felt it was little bit short would have been good to learn bit more history but worth a look
This was one of those great works that will stay with me moving forward.  I have never had the chance to go to DC so i truly appreciated the opportunity to feel like i was there.  5 stars!

review_title: Personal Tour and still want more :-)
one_reviews_text: Excellent overview of what it's like to live in the White House.  The history, the art work, and the personal recollections of both the President and the First Lady is very enriching and informative.  Everyone should have this experience.  Tell you friends, tell strangers, just share it.
The slow moving camera(s) was a nice touch. It didnt hurt to have a president that seemed to embrace VR as much as 44 did. Thank you.
I don't have a clue what the problem is, but this will not start for me at all.

I wish it was longer. One of the coolest parts is sitting right across from President and Michelle Obama and listening to them talk in full 3D. I miss them so much but with this app, I can visit from time to time. Each scene is breathtaking. The movement of light is beautiful. So very well done!
I wish Obama was our president again. Trump is a joke!
I'm so glad this is hosted by Obama and not the president that came after him. Makes the tour worth doing.
